API Documentation¶

REST API Routes¶

class src.routes.router.HashHandler¶

Bases: object

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶
src.routes.router.contacts_birthday_soon(days: int = 7, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves contacts with birthdays within a specified number of days.

Parameters:

  • days (int, optional) – The number of days within which to search for upcoming birthdays.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

src.routes.router.create_new_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Creates a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The details of the contact to be created.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an internal server error.

src.routes.router.delete_contact_route(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Deletes a contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

src.routes.router.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a specific contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

src.routes.router.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int, optional) – The number of contacts to skip (for pagination).

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

src.routes.router.register_user(user: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Registers a new user, hashes their password, and sends an email verification link.

Parameters:

  • user (UserModel) – The user details to be registered.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly registered user.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already registered.

Registers a new user, hashes their password, and sends an email verification link.

Parameters:

  • user (UserModel) – The user details to be registered.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly registered user.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already registered.

src.routes.router.search_contacts_route(name: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Searches for contacts by name or email.

Parameters:

  • name (str, optional) – The name of the contact to search for.

  • email (str, optional) – The email of the contact to search for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search criteria.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts are found.

src.routes.router.update_avatar(request: Request, user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Uploads a user’s avatar to Cloudinary and updates the user’s profile with the new avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user whose avatar is being updated.

  • file (UploadFile) – The avatar file uploaded by the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the URL of the uploaded avatar.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the Cloudinary upload fails or if the user is not found.

src.routes.router.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates a contact’s details for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The new details of the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

src.routes.router.verify_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Verifies a user’s email using a JWT token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token containing the user’s email information.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating that the email has been successfully verified.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid, expired, or if the user is not found.

  • phone_number (str) – The phone number of the contact.

  • birthday (str, optional) – The birthday of the contact (optional).

class src.schemas.EmailSettings(*, MAIL_USERNAME: str, MAIL_PASSWORD: str, MAIL_FROM: EmailStr, MAIL_PORT: int, MAIL_SERVER: str, MAIL_TLS: bool = True, MAIL_SSL: bool = False, MAIL_FROM_NAME: str = 'Your App Name')¶

Bases: BaseModel

Schema for the email configuration settings.

Parameters:

  • MAIL_USERNAME (str) – The email username.

  • MAIL_PASSWORD (str) – The email password.

  • MAIL_FROM (EmailStr) – The email address from which emails are sent.

  • MAIL_PORT (int) – The port used by the email server.

  • MAIL_SERVER (str) – The email server.

  • MAIL_TLS (bool) – Whether to use TLS (True by default).

  • MAIL_SSL (bool) – Whether to use SSL (False by default).

  • MAIL_FROM_NAME (str) – The name shown as the sender in the email.

Authentication¶

class src.auths.auth.Hash¶

Bases: object

Class for handling password hashing using Passlib.

Methods:

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password): Verifies if the plain and hashed passwords match. get_password_hash(password: str): Generates a hash for the given password.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generates a hash for the given password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies if the plain and hashed passwords match.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to check.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if passwords match, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

src.auths.auth.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None) → str¶

Creates an access token with the given data and expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token payload.

  • expires_delta (Optional[timedelta]) – The expiration time for the token. If None, the default expiration is 1 hour.

Returns:

The generated access token.

Return type:

str

src.auths.auth.create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a refresh token with the given data and expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token payload.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time for the token in seconds. If None, the default expiration is 7 days.

Returns:

The generated refresh token.

Return type:

str

src.auths.auth.create_verification_token(email: str)¶

Creates a token for email verification.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to include in the token.

Returns:

The generated email verification token.

Return type:

str

src.auths.auth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves the current user from the access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT access token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user if the token is valid and the user exists in the database.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the credentials are invalid or the user is not found.

src.auths.auth.get_email_from_access_token(token: str) → str | None¶

Retrieves the user’s email from the access token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT access token.

Returns:

The user’s email if it exists in the token, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[str]

src.auths.auth.get_email_from_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Retrieves the email from the refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The JWT refresh token.

Returns:

The email if the token has a valid scope, otherwise raises an HTTPException.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token has an invalid scope or cannot be validated.

src.auths.auth.send_verification_email(email: str, token: str)¶

Sends a verification email with a verification link.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The recipient’s email address.

  • token (str) – The verification token to include in the email.
